radiographic_examinations.findings: Interval development of small pleural effusions with bibasilar atelectasis; a 3 mm perfissural nodule in the right lower lobe; an irregularly shaped hypodense lesion in the liver consistent with hemangioma, stable compared to the recent prior study; a small amount of fluid or phlegmon with foci of air in the gallbladder fossa; normal spleen, appendix, adrenal glands; small hypodensity in the left kidney; diverticulosis in the ascending and transverse colon; no intraperitoneal free air; atherosclerotic disease in the abdominal aorta and left common iliac artery; no suspicious lesions in osseous structures.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Interval development of small pleural effusions with bibasilar atelectasis; irregularly shaped hypodense lesion in the liver is stable compared to the recent prior study.
